00053 typedef unsigned char u8_t;
00054 typedef unsigned short u16_t;

00065 /* Maximum timer interval for 16 bit clock_time_t */
00066 #define INFINITE_TIME 0xffff
00067 
00068 /* Clock ticks per second */
00069 #define CLOCK_CONF_SECOND 128
00070 
00071 /* Maximum tick interval is 0xffff/128 = 511 seconds */
00072 #define RIME_CONF_BROADCAST_ANNOUNCEMENT_MAX_TIME INFINITE_TIME/CLOCK_CONF_SECOND /* Default uses 600 */
00073 #define COLLECT_CONF_BROADCAST_ANNOUNCEMENT_MAX_TIME INFINITE_TIME/CLOCK_CONF_SECOND /* Default uses 600 */
00074 
00075 /* Michael Hartman's atmega128rfa1 board has an external 32768Hz crystal connected to TOSC1 and 2 pins similar to the Raven 1284p */
00076 /* and theoretically can use TIMER2 with it to keep time. Else TIMER0 is used. */
00077 /* The sleep timer in raven-lcd.c also uses the crystal and adds a TIMER2 interrupt routine if not already define by clock.c */
00078 /* This has not been tested yet */
00079 #define AVR_CONF_USE32KCRYSTAL 0
00080 
00081 /* Michael Hartman's protobyte board has LED on PORTE1, can be used for pings and radio on indication */
00082 /* However it requires disabling UART0. */
00083 #define RF230BB_CONF_LEDONPORTE1  1
00084 
00085 /* COM port to be used for SLIP connection. This is usually UART0, but see above */
00086 #if RF230BB_CONF_LEDONPORTE1
00087 #define SLIP_PORT RS232_PORT_1
00088 #else
00089 #define SLIP_PORT RS232_PORT_0
00090 #endif

00132 /* See uip-ds6.h */
00133 #define UIP_CONF_DS6_NBR_NBU      20
00134 #define UIP_CONF_DS6_DEFRT_NBU    2
00135 #define UIP_CONF_DS6_PREFIX_NBU   3
00136 #define UIP_CONF_DS6_ROUTE_NBU    20
00137 #define UIP_CONF_DS6_ADDR_NBU     3

00141 #define UIP_CONF_LL_802154        1
00142 #define UIP_CONF_LLH_LEN          0
00143 
00144 /* 10 bytes per stateful address context - see sicslowpan.c */
00145 /* Default is 1 context with prefix aaaa::/64 */
00146 /* These must agree with all the other nodes or there will be a failure to communicate! */
00147 #define SICSLOWPAN_CONF_MAX_ADDR_CONTEXTS 1
00148 #define SICSLOWPAN_CONF_ADDR_CONTEXT_0 {addr_contexts[0].prefix[0]=0xaa;addr_contexts[0].prefix[1]=0xaa;}
00149 #define SICSLOWPAN_CONF_ADDR_CONTEXT_1 {addr_contexts[1].prefix[0]=0xbb;addr_contexts[1].prefix[1]=0xbb;}
00150 #define SICSLOWPAN_CONF_ADDR_CONTEXT_2 {addr_contexts[2].prefix[0]=0x20;addr_contexts[2].prefix[1]=0x01;addr_contexts[2].prefix[2]=0x49;addr_contexts[2].prefix[3]=0x78,addr_contexts[2].prefix[4]=0x1d;addr_contexts[2].prefix[5]=0xb1;}
00151 
00152 /* 211 bytes per queue buffer */
00153 #define QUEUEBUF_CONF_NUM         8
00154 
00155 /* 54 bytes per queue ref buffer */
00156 #define QUEUEBUF_CONF_REF_NUM     2
00157 
00158 /* Take the default TCP maximum segment size for efficiency and simpler wireshark captures */
00159 /* Use this to prevent 6LowPAN fragmentation (whether or not fragmentation is enabled) */
00160 //#define UIP_CONF_TCP_MSS       48
00161 
00162 /* 30 bytes per TCP connection */
00163 /* 6LoWPAN does not do well with concurrent TCP streams, as new browser GETs collide with packets coming */
00164 /* from previous GETs, causing decreased throughput, retransmissions, and timeouts. Increase to study this. */
00165 /* ACKs to other ports become interleaved with computation-intensive GETs, so ACKs are particularly missed. */
00166 /* Increasing the number of packet receive buffers in RAM helps to keep ACKs from being lost */
00167 
00168 #define UIP_CONF_MAX_CONNECTIONS 4
00169 
00170 /* 2 bytes per TCP listening port */
00171 #define UIP_CONF_MAX_LISTENPORTS 4
00172 
00173 /* 25 bytes per UDP connection */
00174 #define UIP_CONF_UDP_CONNS      10
00175 
00176 #define UIP_CONF_IP_FORWARD      0
00177 #define UIP_CONF_FWCACHE_SIZE    0
00178 
00179 #define UIP_CONF_IPV6_CHECKS     1
00180 #define UIP_CONF_IPV6_QUEUE_PKT  1
00181 #define UIP_CONF_IPV6_REASSEMBLY 0
00182 
00183 #define UIP_CONF_UDP_CHECKSUMS   1
00184 #define UIP_CONF_TCP_SPLIT       1
00185 #define UIP_CONF_DHCP_LIGHT      1
00186 
00187 
00188 #if 1 /* No radio cycling */
00189 
00190 #define NETSTACK_CONF_MAC         nullmac_driver
00191 #define NETSTACK_CONF_RDC         sicslowmac_driver
00192 #define NETSTACK_CONF_FRAMER      framer_802154
00193 #define NETSTACK_CONF_RADIO       rf230_driver
00194 #define CHANNEL_802_15_4          26
00195 /* AUTOACK receive mode gives better rssi measurements, even if ACK is never requested */
00196 #define RF230_CONF_AUTOACK        1
00197 /* Request 802.15.4 ACK on all packets sent (else autoretry). This is primarily for testing. */
00198 #define SICSLOWPAN_CONF_ACK_ALL   0
00199 /* Number of auto retry attempts 0-15 (0 implies don't use extended TX_ARET_ON mode with CCA) */
00200 #define RF230_CONF_AUTORETRIES    2
00201 /* Default is one RAM buffer for received packets. More than one may benefit multiple TCP connections or ports */
00202 #define RF230_CONF_RX_BUFFERS     3
00203 #define SICSLOWPAN_CONF_FRAG      1
00204 /* Most browsers reissue GETs after 3 seconds which stops fragment reassembly so a longer MAXAGE does no good */
00205 #define SICSLOWPAN_CONF_MAXAGE    3
00206 /* How long to wait before terminating an idle TCP connection. Smaller to allow faster sleep. Default is 120 seconds */
00207 /* If wait is too short the connection can be reset as a result of multiple fragment reassembly timeouts */
00208 #define UIP_CONF_WAIT_TIMEOUT     20
00209 
00210 #elif 1  /* Contiki-mac radio cycling */
00211 #define NETSTACK_CONF_MAC         nullmac_driver
00212 //#define NETSTACK_CONF_MAC         csma_driver
00213 #define NETSTACK_CONF_RDC         contikimac_driver
00214 #define NETSTACK_CONF_FRAMER      framer_802154
00215 #define NETSTACK_CONF_RADIO       rf230_driver
00216 #define CHANNEL_802_15_4          26
00217 /* The radio needs to interrupt during an rtimer interrupt */
00218 #define RTIMER_CONF_NESTED_INTERRUPTS 1
00219 #define RF230_CONF_AUTOACK        1
00220 #define RF230_CONF_AUTORETRIES    1
00221 #define RF230_CONF_CSMARETRIES    1
00222 #define CONTIKIMAC_CONF_RADIO_ALWAYS_ON  0
00223 #define SICSLOWPAN_CONF_FRAG      1
00224 #define SICSLOWPAN_CONF_MAXAGE    3
00225 #define NETSTACK_CONF_RDC_CHANNEL_CHECK_RATE 8
00226 
00227 #elif 1  /* cx-mac radio cycling */
00228 /* RF230 does clear-channel assessment in extended mode (autoretries>0) */
00229 #define RF230_CONF_AUTORETRIES    1
00230 #if RF230_CONF_AUTORETRIES
00231 #define NETSTACK_CONF_MAC         nullmac_driver
00232 #else
00233 #define NETSTACK_CONF_MAC         csma_driver
00234 #endif
00235 #define NETSTACK_CONF_RDC         cxmac_driver
00236 #define NETSTACK_CONF_FRAMER      framer_802154
00237 #define NETSTACK_CONF_RADIO       rf230_driver
00238 #define CHANNEL_802_15_4          26
00239 #define RF230_CONF_AUTOACK        1
00240 #define SICSLOWPAN_CONF_FRAG      1
00241 #define SICSLOWPAN_CONF_MAXAGE    3
00242 #define CXMAC_CONF_ANNOUNCEMENTS  0
00243 #define NETSTACK_CONF_RDC_CHANNEL_CHECK_RATE 8
00244 
00245 //Below gives 10% duty cycle, undef for default 5%
00246 //#define CXMAC_CONF_ON_TIME (RTIMER_ARCH_SECOND / 80)
00247 //Below gives 50% duty cycle
00248 //#define CXMAC_CONF_ON_TIME (RTIMER_ARCH_SECOND / 16)
00249 
00250 #else
00251 #error Network configuration not specified!
00252 #endif   /* Network setup */

00254 /* Logging adds 200 bytes to program size */
00255 #define LOG_CONF_ENABLED         1

00257 /* ************************************************************************** */
00258 //#pragma mark RPL Settings
00259 /* ************************************************************************** */
00260 #if UIP_CONF_IPV6_RPL
00261 
00262 /* Define MAX_*X_POWER to reduce tx power and ignore weak rx packets for testing a miniature multihop network.
00263  * Leave undefined for full power and sensitivity.
00264  * tx=0 (3dbm, default) to 15 (-17.2dbm)
00265  * RF230_CONF_AUTOACK sets the extended mode using the energy-detect register with rx=0 (-91dBm) to 84 (-7dBm)
00266  *   else the rssi register is used having range 0 (91dBm) to 28 (-10dBm)
00267  *   For simplicity RF230_MIN_RX_POWER is based on the energy-detect value and divided by 3 when autoack is not set.
00268  * On the RF230 a reduced rx power threshold will not prevent autoack if enabled and requested.
00269  * These numbers applied to both Raven and Jackdaw give a maximum communication distance of about 15 cm
00270  * and a 10 meter range to a full-sensitivity RF230 sniffer.
00271 #define RF230_MAX_TX_POWER 15
00272 #define RF230_MIN_RX_POWER 30
00273  */
00274 
00275 #define UIP_CONF_ROUTER                 1
00276 #define UIP_CONF_ND6_SEND_RA                0
00277 #define UIP_CONF_ND6_REACHABLE_TIME     600000
00278 #define UIP_CONF_ND6_RETRANS_TIMER      10000
